body.p: To His Excellency B Magoffin Govrnor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

the undersigned citizens of Laurel County would respectfully represent that F T Hodge of this county was Indited in the Laurel Circuit Court for an assault upon Daniel Elam and was Tried at the March Term of Said Court 1861 and fined $75,00

We are personally acquainted with F T Hodge and know him To be a man of good morals have never Known him To be in any dificulty before or Since the one here refeered To, Hodge and Elam was a lone when the fight came up and Elam who Set the prosecution on foot and his Brother who came up a bout the close of the fight was the only witnesses there was no Serious injury done we are informed that Hodge has petitioned your Excellency To remit the fine we believe Hodge To be a man of Truth and would make a true statement of the facts Hodge is a poore man with a family and if forced To pay the fine it will be oppressive and from our own Knowledge of the circumstances Surrounding the case we would most respectfully ask the fine To be remitted

John M Jackson
C. B. Faris clk cir ct
Jno. C Hurling
C. W. Catching
J. R. Martin
Lem, Hibbard
Wm H. Jackson
G. W. Millen
N. B. Jones, P. J. L, C
Henry Wisor
Reuben Whitehead
S C Jackson Ex S. L. C
Wash Johnson
Levi Jackson

Laurel Cir. Ct
Respite 6 mo
B, M
$75. } assault
F. T. Hodge
May 13. 1861
